means: [人名] [英格兰人姓氏] 布里斯绰号，惹人恼怒者，来源于中世纪英语，含义是“牛虻”(gadfly)
[人名] [威尔士人姓氏] 布里斯取自父名，来源于ab+Rhys,含义是“里斯之子”(son of Rhys)

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这两个名词均有"风"之意。
means: wind ： 普通用词，指空气的流动现象。

sentence.Network_en: The blustery winds of spring had dropped to a gentle breeze.
sentence.Network_cn: 呼啸的春风已经减弱，成了习习的微风。

sentence.Network_en: The tops of the trees rippled in the breeze.
sentence.Network_cn: 树冠在微风中婆娑摇曳。

sentence.Network_en: The sun went in, and the breeze became cold.
sentence.Network_cn: 云层遮住了太阳，微风有了些凉意。

derivation.yuyuan_name: mid 16th cent.: probably from Old Spanish and Portuguese briza 'NE wind' (the original sense in English)
late 16th cent.: from French braise, (earlier) brese 'live coals'

encyclopedia.content: 英文单词 breeze n. 1. 微风，和风[C] The flags fluttered in the breeze. 旗帜在微风中飘扬。 2. 【美】【口】轻而易举的事[S] Teaching is by no means a breeze. 教书决非易事。 3. 谣传，传闻[C] She breezed through that difficult book. 她毫无困难地把那本难读的书读完了。 There came a breeze that his wife had eloped with her lover. 有谣言说他妻子与她情人私奔了。 4. 【英】【口】骚动，争吵[C] vi. 1. 吹着微风

entry.def: A breeze is a gentle wind.

entry.tran: 随意轻松地进入；漫步走入
entry.def: If you breeze into a place or a position, you enter it in a very casual or relaxed manner.

example.ex: Lopez breezed into the quarter-finals of the tournament...
example.tran: 洛佩斯轻松打入了锦标赛的四分之一决赛。

example.ex: 'Are you all right?' Francine asked as she breezed in with the mail.
example.tran: “你没事吧？”芙朗辛拿着邮件踱步走进来，问道。

entry.tran: 轻松过关，轻易通过（比赛或测试）
entry.def: If you breeze through something such as a game or test, you cope with it easily.

example.ex: John seems to breeze effortlessly through his many commitments at work.
example.tran: 约翰似乎不费吹灰之力就完成了很多工作任务。

entry.def: If you say that something is a breeze, you mean that it is very easy to do or to achieve.

example.ex: And after being an office manager for 20 people, handling my own tiny staff of three is a breeze!...
example.tran: 我曾经是管理着20个人的办公室经理，现在领导区区3名员工不费吹灰之力！

example.ex: Making the pastry is a breeze if you have a food processor.
example.tran: 如果你有食品加工机，做这种点心轻而易举。

sentences.sentence: "the breeze was cooled by the lake"
"as he waited he could feel the air on his neck"

means.word_mean: 2. any undertaking that is easy to do;

sentences.sentence: "marketing this product will be no picnic"
"It breezes most evenings at the shore"

sentences.en: The banner fluttered in the breeze.

sentences.cn: 他轻快地完成了那项工作。

jushi.english: It was steaming hot; there was no breeze at all.
jushi.chinese: 天气闷热,一点风也没有。

jushi.english: The banner fluttered in the breeze.
